channel.title: Licking Envelopes on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Licking Envelopes on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Lickety Split
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Considering all the money that the greeting card industry spends on making really interesting looking cards (but not as interesting, of course, as they were when Robert Crumb was a greeting card illustrator), I have a question: Why do gift card envelopes still rely on a kind of glue that adheres with licking? Do they not realize that people frequently write these cards in pen, and might realize, halfway through the process, that they forgot a loved one?
